16.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
16.str2: Apparently a primary verb; to be beforehand, i.e. Anticipate or precede; by extension, to have arrived at.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

16.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
16.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

17.str2: A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

17.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
17.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

17.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
17.str2: To separate from some one, be bereaved. From apo and a derivative of orphanos; to bereave wholly, i.e. separate.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

17.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
17.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

17.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
17.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.

17.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
17.str2: To hasten, be eager, be zealous. From spoude; to use speed, i.e. To make effort, be prompt or earnest.

18.str2: On this account, because, for. From dia and hoti; on the very account that, or inasmuch as.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
18.str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
18.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
18.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
Once, once for all. Probably from hapas; one time.
Twice, entirely, utterly. Adverb from duo; twice.
An adversary, Satan. Of Chaldee origin corresponding to ma'bad; the accuser, i.e. The devil.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: To interrupt, hinder. From en and kopto; to cut into, i.e. impede, detain.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
18.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

19.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

19.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
19.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
19.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A crown, garland, honor, glory. From an apparently primary stepho; a chaplet, literally or figuratively.
The act of boasting, glorying, exultation. From kauchaomai; boasting, in a good or a bad sense.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
By no means, not at all. Intensive of ou; not indeed.

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
19.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From en and pros; in front of (literally or figuratively) or time).

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
19.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
19.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the present participle of pareimi; a being near, i.e. Advent; physically, aspect.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

20.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
20.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
